name: HD 139357
scenarioDescription:
The HD 139357 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 139357 is a star with 1.35 times the mass of the Sun, and 11.47 times its radius. It is located 366.76 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.07 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

HD 139357 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 139357 system


HD 139357 b

HD 139357 b was discovered by the Thueringer Landessternwarte Tautenburg observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 2.36 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 139357 b is 3103.68 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, HD 139357 b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system HD 139357, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Thueringer Landessternwarte Tautenburg.
